intro: Hedeoma subaequale, commonly known as the narrowleaf hedeoma, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, gray-green leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in sagebrush habitats. Hedeoma subaequale is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
